block.p: Claire Marvel Tisne, the daughter of Jean and Peter B. Tisne of Brooklyn, was married last evening to Ian David Aaron Haft, the son of Dr. Gail Klein Haft and Dr. Jacob I. Haft of Tenafly, N.J. Rabbi Ari Fridkis officiated at the Metropolitan Building in Long Island City, Queens, with the Rev. Dr. William Nye, a minister of the United Church of Christ, taking part.

The bride, 35, will continue to use her name professionally. She is a vice president and the director of subsidiary rights, as well as an editor, at Random House in Manhattan. She graduated from Kenyon College. Her father is a partner in Emmet, Marvin & Martin, a Manhattan law firm. Her mother is tutors students in a variety of subjects in Brooklyn.The bridegroom, 36, is a vice president for acquisitions at the ACI Capital Company, an investment firm in Manhattan. He graduated from Dartmouth and received a law degree and an M.B.A. from Columbia.

Claire Marvel Tisne, the daughter of Jean and Peter B. Tisne of Brooklyn, was married last evening to Ian David Aaron Haft, the son of Dr. Gail Klein Haft and Dr. Jacob I. Haft of Tenafly, N.J. Rabbi Ari Fridkis officiated at the Metropolitan Building in Long Island City, Queens, with the Rev. Dr. William Nye, a minister of the United Church of Christ, taking part.

Claire Marvel Tisne, the daughter of Jean and Peter B. Tisne of Brooklyn, was married last evening to Ian David Aaron Haft, the son of Dr. Gail Klein Haft and Dr. Jacob I. Haft of Tenafly, N.J. Rabbi Ari Fridkis officiated at the Metropolitan Building in Long Island City, Queens, with the Rev. Dr. William Nye, a minister of the United Church of Christ, taking part.

The bride, 35, will continue to use her name professionally. She is a vice president and the director of subsidiary rights, as well as an editor, at Random House in Manhattan. She graduated from Kenyon College. Her father is a partner in Emmet, Marvin & Martin, a Manhattan law firm. Her mother is tutors students in a variety of subjects in Brooklyn.The bridegroom, 36, is a vice president for acquisitions at the ACI Capital Company, an investment firm in Manhattan. He graduated from Dartmouth and received a law degree and an M.B.A. from Columbia.

His mother, a pediatrician, retired as the medical director, in Paramus, N.J., for the special-services school district in Bergen County. His father is a cardiologist practicing in Hackensack, N.J., and in Newark.
